basics.name: Aaron Shakibpanah
basics.label: Student at Yeshiva University
basics.summary: Aaron is from Miami, and he is currently in the process of earning a degree from Yeshiva University in Computer Science. Before his internship at Deloitte, he founded The ACM at Yeshiva University, and was the Director of Consulting for TAMID at Yeshiva University. While Aaron is currently working in Tax Technology, his passion is for building large, scaleable, and fault tolerant architechture.

work.summary: Deloitte is one of the 'Big Four' accounting organizations and the largest professional services network in the world by revenue and number of professionals. Deloitte provides audit, tax, consulting, enterprise risk and financial advisory services with more than 263,900 professionals globally.
highlights: Developed highly optimized modeling software regarding tax reform for clients and their subsidiaries
Built a roadmap for the team's technology devision with business use cases for every new technology being incorporated and a design for the team's serverless architechture
Helped create a distributed system for processing some of the team's more robust models
Technologies Used: Python, C#, VBA, AWS (Lambda, EC2, and S3)

work.summary: The ACM (Association for Computing Machinery), founded in 1947, is the largest and oldest international scientific and industrial computer society. Through its many Special Interest Group s, the ACM fosters research and communication in a broad range of computing areas. At Yeshiva University, the focus of the ACM is to have bi-weekly workshops to introduce students to new technologies, host engaging speakers, and provide a platform for students to prepare themselves to be as effective in the computing industry as possible.
highlights: Founded the club under Yeshiva University and The ACM

work.summary: InteractBot is a hybrid chatbot solution for enterprise companies.
highlights: Built and distributed python modules for integration with enterprise clients and their platforms
Developed several programs that enrich and organize extremely large datasets
Deployed various REST APIs for clients
Technologies Used: Python, JavaScript, MongoDB, SQL, and Flask/Bottle

work.position: Project Manager/Director of Consulting/National Consulting Committee Member/Fellow
work.summary: The TAMID Group is a nonprofit organization that develops the professional skills of undergraduate students through hands-on interaction with the Israeli economy via consulting for Israeli startups and managing an investment fund.
highlights: Managed a consulting team working with the CEO of an Israeli Telemedicine Startup
Looked over several consulting teams and their clients with regular surveys and team meetings to ensure an effective turnout
Helped create new educational material for consulting teams nationwide and attended regular meetings with the consulting commitee
One of 120 students selected to work and study in israel for the summer

volunteer.summary: Teacher's assistant for Intro To Computer Science with Java.
The Magen David Adom is Israel's national emergency medical, disaster, ambulance and blood bank service.
